title: I Think Ascension is most balanced game mode right now
body:
- Exp and Gold are distributed equally, preventing from complete stomps
- Has a ban phase, so you can ban complete cancer champs like shaco/teemo
- Has way less cancer champs than SR
- Has more strategies than SR
- Requires teamwork to win
- Takes less time than SR game

So, why don't we bring Ascension as a basic game mod, and put SR into RGM queue until the shit currently happening with game is fixed?  I never liked Ascension, i would rather have old Dominion back, but man, it feels much better to play with new runes than SR games.

But that aside, URFcension does sound like a neat idea.

I would actually argue that you are wrong on that. Right now, many of the really powerful URF picks (with the exception of Fuckstick Ezreal) are champions with the ability to solidly shred you from long range before you can close the gap; due to the CQB nature of the Crystal Scar; those guys can't just blow you up from range as reliably as you have more bushes to take advantage of to get close without being seen. In order to really abuse those amped-up kits they NEED others nearby to defend them.

In addition, assuming the "constant stream of gold/XP" carries over as well, that eliminates another huge URF issue: people with solid poke comps seizing and abusing an early game lead. You can be behind a few kills without completely losing the ability to duel due to being behind.

Lastly (everyone's favorite aspect of Ascension) marksmen lose their mandatory status, as there aren't any objectives to worry about.

The only issue I see with URFscension is that Nunu and Ivern will be even more worthless than they already are in URF.

Well, currently the meta is KILLKILLKILL. Get a small lead, snowball off of that because damage is overtuned, then activate full freight train mode to crush the opponents' base in one fell swoop. Well, yes, objectives do matter, but not in the right way. 

- Earth and water dragon are almost irrelevant because winning through methodically gaining small advantages/ sustained siege and attrition is not viable. 

- Blue only matters in the first 5 minutes of the game. Beyond 2nd blue it might as well not exist for about 90% of the champion roster. 

- Baron is now routinely taken at <25 minutes while that should be a massively risky proposition because teams should lack the raw dps to down it quickly enough for the other team not to notice combined with the still relatively short death timers at that point in the game. Taking Baron that easily that early in the game should only be realistically feasible if you have at least 2 earth dragons IMO.

- Rift Herald is too strong. I like the concept of an earlygame toplane objective but it probably should give some different and less powerful bonus.

- Smart wave/ lane management is greatly reduced in value once you get a kill advantage because having a kill advantage is too impactful.
